required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effectiveness of Dry Needling and Ischemic Compression in Sternocleidomastoid, on Cervical Motor Control in Patients With Cervical Pain.
clinical_study.official_title: Effectiveness of Dry Needling and Ischemic Compression in the Sternocleidomastoid, on Cervical Motor Control in Patients With Cervical Pain, Versus Placebo Technique and Ischemic Compression, Randomized Trial.

brief_summary.textblock: This study will compare the effect of dry needling on the active trigger point on sternocleidomastoid versus the effect of dry needling at 1.5 centimeters of active trigger point on sternocleidomastoid, both combined with ischemic compression, on cervical pain and cervical motor control short and medium term.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Randomized Clinical Trial (RCT) with two groups.
study_design_info.masking_description: Double-blind, masking the patient and the outcomes assesor. A simple randomization will be performed with Epidat software.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-intervention, immediately post-intervention, 1 day, 1 week, 1 month
primary_outcome.description: Changes in the level of Cervical Pain.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-intervention, immediately post-intervention, 1 day, 1 week, 1 month
primary_outcome.description: Change in the Cervical Motor Control

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-intervention, immediately post-intervention, 1 day, 1 week, 1 month
secondary_outcome.description: Changes in grades of cervical movement

secondary_outcome.measure: Coordination of superficial and deep cervical flexor muscles
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-intervention, immediately post-intervention, 1 day, 1 week, 1 month
secondary_outcome.description: Changes in the coordination of cervical flexor muscles

arm_group.arm_group_label: Dry Needling and Ischemic Compression at the Trigger Point
arm_group.description: Dry Needling and Ischemic Compression at the Trigger Point

arm_group.arm_group_label: Intervention at 1.5 cm from the Trigger Point
arm_group.description: Dry Needling and Ischemic Compression at 1.5 centimeters from the Trigger Point

intervention.intervention_name: Dry Needling and Ischemic Compression at the Trigger Point
intervention.description: The intervention consist on dry needling in the active trigger point, and next, do ischemic compression in the same point.
intervention.arm_group_label: Dry Needling and Ischemic Compression at the Trigger Point

intervention.intervention_name: Dry Needling and Ischemic Compression at 1.5 centimeters from the Trigger Point
intervention.description: The intervention consist on dry needling at 1.5 centimeters from the active trigger point, and next, do ischemic compression in the same point.
intervention.arm_group_label: Intervention at 1.5 cm from the Trigger Point

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Be between 18 and 65 years old
- Have pain in the cervical region, which extends from the occipital to the 7th cervical vertebra.
- Have an active trigger point on the sternocleidomastoid.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Present history of trauma in the neck.
- Present cervical radiculopathy
- Present a vestibular pathology
- Previous surgery on the neck or shoulder area
- Having a primary headache diagnosis
- Have received dry needling in the neck in the previous 6 months
- Present cognitive deficit.
- Be pregnant
- Taking anticoagulants.
- Have phobia to the needles (belonephobia).
